description: From Latin iterō (“do it for a second time, repeat”), from iterum (“again”), akin to is (“he, that”).

examples: f2(x0) is the second iterate of x0 under f.

verbs.description: iterate (third-person singular simple present iterates, present participle iterating, simple past and past participle iterated)

entries.meaning: (computing) to perform or repeat an action on each item in a set
examples: The max() function iterates through the data to find the highest value.

entries.meaning: (computing, mathematics) to perform or repeat an action on the results of each such prior action
examples: In mathematics, an iterated function is a function which is composed with itself, possibly ad infinitum, in a process called iteration.

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To utter or do a second time or many times; to repeat.
(design, transitive, intransitive) To repeat an activity, making incremental changes each time
